clinical_study.brief_title: Mortality Due to COVID-19 in the COVID-AGEBRU Study
clinical_study.official_title: Predictors of Intrahospital Mortality in Older Patients Admitted Due to COVID-19 in the COVID-19 AGEBRU Study

brief_summary.textblock: The COVID-Age Brugmann study aims to identify the clinical predictors of mortality risk in older patients admitted to an acute care unit due to COVID-19

detailed_description.textblock:
The COVID-19 disease has been shown to be associated to higher mortality risk and health adverse consequences. Despite of the fact that the SAR-COV2 virus has been shown that affects every populations, the negative impact is higher in older people, pointing this population as the most severely affected.
The COVID-Age Brugmann study aims to identify if comorbidity, geriatric syndromes, and health issues at admission are associated to mortality risk in older patients admitted to an acute care unit due to COVID-19

primary_outcome.measure: All-cause mortality during hospital admission (admission up to discharge time)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of one month.
primary_outcome.description: Vital status was obtained from medical records

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of medical diseases and geriatric syndromes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of one month.
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical and demographical conditions, and geriatric syndromes

study_pop.textblock: Consecutive patients aged 70 and over hospitalized in an acute care unit in Brugmann university hospital, in Belgium, due to COVID-19 in the period Mars to June 2020.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged 70 and older
- Patients admitted to an acute care geriatric unit due to COVID-19
- Patients with COVID-19 by PCR, serology or CT scan suggestive of this disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- No other demographic or clinical exclusion criteria will be applied
